title: Higher latitude chain (Lat 60.8, Long 281.9), Ground-based Vector Magnetic Field at Akulivik, Quebec, Canada, 0.5 sec, AUTUMNX network, Canadian Space Agency GO program and Athabasca University - M. Connors and I. Schofield (Athabasca U)

info.contact: M. Connors and I. Schofield @ Athabasca U

parameters.name: thg_mag_akul
parameters.description: Magnetic field B in HDZ vector components

parameters.name: thg_magh_akul
parameters.description: ---> H - Local magnetic North component of B. This variable is a 'virtual' variable that is computed using the function make_stack_array (see https://cdaweb.gsfc.nasa.gov/pub/software/cdawlib/source/virtual_funcs.pro) on the with inputs of the variables ['thg_mag_akul']. Note that some COMPONENTS may not be available from the HAPI interface. They are accessible from the raw CDF files, however.

parameters.name: thg_magd_akul
parameters.description: ---> E - Local magnetic East component of B. This variable is a 'virtual' variable that is computed using the function make_stack_array (see https://cdaweb.gsfc.nasa.gov/pub/software/cdawlib/source/virtual_funcs.pro) on the with inputs of the variables ['thg_mag_akul']. Note that some COMPONENTS may not be available from the HAPI interface. They are accessible from the raw CDF files, however.

parameters.name: thg_magz_akul
parameters.description: ---> Z - Local vertical down component of B. This variable is a 'virtual' variable that is computed using the function make_stack_array (see https://cdaweb.gsfc.nasa.gov/pub/software/cdawlib/source/virtual_funcs.pro) on the with inputs of the variables ['thg_mag_akul']. Note that some COMPONENTS may not be available from the HAPI interface. They are accessible from the raw CDF files, however.
